UML2 2.1m4
EMF 2.3m5

Using the UML2 Model Editor, trying to create a template signature under a Class element results in the exception at the end of this comment. No error dialog comes up, and I only noticed the problem because I run Eclipse with -consolelog as a habit.

I had to take a look at the code to understand that Classifier requires a RedefinableTemplateSignature. I could not find anything about this restriction in the spec, but since it is so hard to find anything in the spec, maybe this is there somewhere.

But the real thing this bug is about is the lack of information given to the user. The validation exception is wrapped into a meaningless generic runtime exception (WrappedException), which makes it harder to see it, and then logged as a warning(?). I would expect an error dialog explaining what restriction was violated in terms the user could understand. At least give us a log entry with a meaningful error message. And please don't eat runtime exceptions. If not swallowed, they rise to the workbench event loop, which will produce a generic "Internal Error" dialog. That at least would give a clue to the user that the error log should be checked.
